questions.question: What is the difference between Error and Exceptions?

answers.a: Errors can be handled by the programmer, whereas exceptions cannot be handled
answers.b: Exceptions can be handled by the programmer, errors cannot be handled
answers.c: Errors can be handled using try except block, whereas exceptions cannot be handled using try except block

questions.question: Which of the following is not a built-in exception in Python?
Which keyword is used to raise an exception manually in Python?
Which of the following scenario holds true with respect to the finally block execution

answers.a: Finally block always gets executed irrespective of the errors and exceptions
answers.b: Finally block gets executed only when there are no errors in your program
answers.c: Finally block gets executed only when there is an exception in your program

questions.question: What is the difference between the
and
blocks in exception handling in Python?

answers.a: block is used to catch and handle exceptions, while the
block is used for cleanup operations.
answers.b: block is used to ensure a specific block of code is always executed, while the
block is used to catch and handle exceptions.
answers.c: block is used to raise an exception manually, while the
block is used to define code that will always execute.
